Plasma\\Schemas\\ColumnDefinition.name: Plasma\Schemas\ColumnDefinition
Plasma\\Schemas\\ColumnDefinition.long_desc: It takes input and outputs it without any changes.

isAutoIncrement.name: isAutoIncrement
isAutoIncrement.short_desc: Whether the column is auto incremented.

isMultipleKey.name: isMultipleKey
isMultipleKey.short_desc: Whether the column is part of a multiple/composite key.

isNullable.name: isNullable
isNullable.short_desc: Whether the column is nullable (not `NOT NULL`).

isPrimaryKey.name: isPrimaryKey
isPrimaryKey.short_desc: Whether the column is the primary key.

isUniqueKey.name: isUniqueKey
isUniqueKey.short_desc: Whether the column is the unique key.

isUnsigned.name: isUnsigned
isUnsigned.short_desc: Whether the column is unsigned (only makes sense for numeric types).

isZerofilled.name: isZerofilled
isZerofilled.short_desc: Whether the column gets zerofilled to the length.

autoIncrement.name: autoIncrement
autoIncrement.short_desc: Set the column as auto incremented.

createWithSchema.name: createWithSchema
createWithSchema.short_desc: Builds a new builder instance and pre-sets the database and table name.

flags.name: flags
flags.short_desc: Set the flags. Typically driver dependent.

Plasma\\Schemas\\DirectoryInterface.name: Plasma\Schemas\DirectoryInterface
Plasma\\Schemas\\DirectoryInterface.short_desc: Directories are responsible for building schemas from query results and interfaces with the repository for queries.

buildSchemas.name: buildSchemas
buildSchemas.short_desc: Builds schemas for the given SELECT query result.

fetch.name: fetch
fetch.short_desc: Fetch a row by the unique identifier. Resolves with an instance of `SchemaCollection`.

fetchAll.name: fetchAll
fetchAll.short_desc: Fetches all rows. Resolves with an instance of `SchemaCollection`.

fetchBy.name: fetchBy
fetchBy.short_desc: Fetch a row by the specified column. Resolves with an instance of `SchemaCollection`.

insert.name: insert
insert.short_desc: Inserts a row. Resolves with an instance of `SchemaCollection`.

insertAll.name: insertAll
insertAll.short_desc: Inserts a list of rows. Resolves with an instance of `SchemaCollection`.
insertAll.long_desc:
Options is an optional array, which supports these options:
```
array(
    'ignoreConflict' => bool, (whether duplicate key conflicts get ignored, defaults to false)
)
```

Some builders may support more options.

update.name: update
update.short_desc: Updates the row with the given data, identified by a specific field.

Plasma\\Schemas\\Repository.name: Plasma\Schemas\Repository
Plasma\\Schemas\\Repository.short_desc: The repository is responsible for turning row results into specified PHP object.
Plasma\\Schemas\\Repository.long_desc:
The repository uses internally an actual plasma client, itself has no client implementation.
Not implementing the interface prevents bugs (expecting a query result but getting a schema collection).

SELECT queries will be wrapped (if a schema builder exists for the table) within a `SchemaCollection`.
All other queries get returned as is.

beginTransaction.name: beginTransaction
beginTransaction.short_desc: Begins a transaction. Resolves with a `TransactionInterface` instance.
beginTransaction.long_desc:
Checks out a connection until the transaction gets committed or rolled back.
It must be noted that the user is responsible for finishing the transaction. The client WILL NOT automatically
check the connection back into the pool, as long as the transaction is not finished.

Some databases, including MySQL, automatically issue an implicit COMMIT when a database definition language (DDL)
statement such as DROP TABLE or CREATE TABLE is issued within a transaction.
The implicit COMMIT will prevent you from rolling back any other changes within the transaction boundary.

checkinConnection.name: checkinConnection
checkinConnection.short_desc: Checks a connection back in, if usable and not closing.

close.name: close
close.short_desc: Closes all connections gracefully after processing all outstanding requests.

createReadCursor.name: createReadCursor
createReadCursor.short_desc: Creates a new cursor to seek through SELECT query results. Resolves with a `CursorInterface` instance.
exceptions: Thrown if the driver or DBMS does not support cursors.

execute.name: execute
execute.short_desc: Prepares and executes a query. Resolves with a `QueryResultInterface` instance.
execute.long_desc:
This is equivalent to prepare -> execute -> close.
If you need to execute a query multiple times, prepare the query manually for performance reasons.

getDirectory.name: getDirectory
getDirectory.short_desc: Get the directory for the schema.

schemaName.name: schemaName
schemaName.short_desc: The schema name. This would be the table name.

prepare.name: prepare
prepare.short_desc: Prepares a query. Resolves with a `StatementInterface` instance.

query.name: query
query.short_desc: Executes a plain query. Resolves with a `QueryResultInterface` instance.

quit.name: quit
quit.short_desc: Forcefully closes the connection, without waiting for any outstanding requests. This will reject all outstanding requests.

quote.name: quote
quote.short_desc: Quotes the string for use in the query.
exceptions: Thrown if the driver does not support quoting.

type.name: type
type.short_desc: For types, see the driver interface constants.

registerDirectory.name: registerDirectory
registerDirectory.short_desc: Register a directory for the schema to be used by the repository.

schemaName.name: schemaName
schemaName.short_desc: The schema name. This would be the table name.

runCommand.name: runCommand
runCommand.hint_desc: Return depends on command and driver.
exceptions: Thrown if the client is closing all connections.

runQuery.name: runQuery
runQuery.short_desc: Runs the given querybuilder on an underlying driver instance.
runQuery.long_desc:
The driver CAN throw an exception if the given querybuilder is not supported.
An example would be a SQL querybuilder and a Cassandra driver.

unregisterDirectory.name: unregisterDirectory
unregisterDirectory.short_desc: Unregister the directory of the schema.

schemaName.name: schemaName
schemaName.short_desc: The schema name. This would be the table name.

Plasma\\Schemas\\RepositoryInterface.name: Plasma\Schemas\RepositoryInterface
Plasma\\Schemas\\RepositoryInterface.short_desc: The repository is responsible for turning query results into schemas and interfaces with a Plasma Client implementation.

getDirectory.name: getDirectory
getDirectory.short_desc: Get the directory for the schema.

schemaName.name: schemaName
schemaName.short_desc: The schema name. This would be the table name.

registerDirectory.name: registerDirectory
registerDirectory.short_desc: Register a directory for the schema to be used by the repository.

schemaName.name: schemaName
schemaName.short_desc: The schema name. This would be the table name.

unregisterDirectory.name: unregisterDirectory
unregisterDirectory.short_desc: Unregister the directory of the schema.

schemaName.name: schemaName
schemaName.short_desc: The schema name. This would be the table name.

Plasma\\Schemas\\SQLDirectory.name: Plasma\Schemas\SQLDirectory
Plasma\\Schemas\\SQLDirectory.short_desc: This is a SQL Directory implementation.

schema.name: schema
schema.short_desc: The class name of the schema to build for.

buildSchemas.name: buildSchemas
buildSchemas.short_desc: Builds schemas for the given SELECT query result.

fetch.name: fetch
fetch.short_desc: Fetch a row by the unique identifier. Resolves with an instance of `SchemaCollection`.

fetchAll.name: fetchAll
fetchAll.short_desc: Fetches all rows. Resolves with an instance of `SchemaCollection`.

fetchBy.name: fetchBy
fetchBy.short_desc: Fetch a row by the specified column. Resolves with an instance of `SchemaCollection`.

insert.name: insert
insert.short_desc: Inserts a row. Resolves with an instance of `SchemaCollection`, if there is a primary column. Otherwise resolves with the query result.

insertAll.name: insertAll
insertAll.short_desc: Inserts a list of rows. Resolves with an instance of `SchemaCollection`.
insertAll.long_desc:
All inserts get wrapped into a transaction.

Options is an optional array, which supports these options:
```
array(
    'ignoreConflict' => bool, (whether duplicate key conflicts get ignored, defaults to false)
    'conflictResolution' => \Plasma\Schema\OnConflict, (a conflict resolution strategy, this option takes precedence)
    'transactionIsolation' => int, (a transaction isolation level from the TransactionInterface constants, defaults to ISOLATION_COMMITTED)
)
```

This method has a dependency on the `plasma/sql-common` package.

update.name: update
update.short_desc: Updates the row with the given data, identified by a specific field.

Plasma\\Schemas\\Schema.name: Plasma\Schemas\Schema
Plasma\\Schemas\\Schema.short_desc: This is a schema class which maps each rows column to a camelcase property.
Plasma\\Schemas\\Schema.long_desc:
This class must be extended and the properties must be provided by the extending class (but not as private).
This allows validation and match expectations.

delete.name: delete
delete.short_desc: Deletes the row. Resolves with a `QueryResultInterface` instance.

getColDefBuilder.name: getColDefBuilder
getColDefBuilder.short_desc: Get a new instance of a column definition builder.

getDatabaseName.name: getDatabaseName
getDatabaseName.short_desc: Returns the name of the database (or any other equivalent).

getIdentifierColumn.name: getIdentifierColumn
getIdentifierColumn.short_desc: Returns the name of the identifier column (primary or unique), or null.

getTableName.name: getTableName
getTableName.short_desc: Returns the name of the table (or any other equivalent).

toArray.name: toArray
toArray.short_desc: Returns an array with all values mapped by the column name.

update.name: update
update.short_desc: Updates the row with the new data. Resolves with a `QueryResultInterface` instance.

validateData.name: validateData
validateData.short_desc: Child classes can override this method to implement some sort of validation.
validateData.long_desc: This method gets invoked after assigning the properties. It has no functionality by default.

Plasma\\Schemas\\SchemaCollection.name: Plasma\Schemas\SchemaCollection
Plasma\\Schemas\\SchemaCollection.short_desc: Schema Collections hold schemas and the associated query result together.

Plasma\\Schemas\\SchemaInterface.name: Plasma\Schemas\SchemaInterface
Plasma\\Schemas\\SchemaInterface.short_desc: Schemas represent data rows and as such can be used to interact with the DBMS through the Repository and Schema Builder.

getDatabaseName.name: getDatabaseName
getDatabaseName.short_desc: Returns the name of the database (or any other equivalent).

getIdentifierColumn.name: getIdentifierColumn
getIdentifierColumn.short_desc: Returns the name of the identifier column (primary or unique), or null.

getTableName.name: getTableName
getTableName.short_desc: Returns the name of the table (or any other equivalent).

update.name: update
update.short_desc: Updates the row with the new data.

Plasma\\Schemas\\Statement.name: Plasma\Schemas\Statement
Plasma\\Schemas\\Statement.short_desc: Represents a Prepared Statement. This class however wraps a statement instance.

close.name: close
close.short_desc: Closes the prepared statement and frees the associated resources on the server.
close.long_desc: Closing a statement more than once SHOULD have no effect.

execute.name: execute
execute.short_desc: Executes the prepared statement. Resolves with a `QueryResult` instance.

getID.name: getID
getID.short_desc: Get the driver-dependent ID of this statement.
getID.long_desc: The return type can be of ANY type, as the ID depends on the driver and DBMS.

isClosed.name: isClosed
isClosed.short_desc: Whether the statement has been closed.

runQuery.name: runQuery
runQuery.short_desc: Runs the given querybuilder on an underlying driver instance.
runQuery.long_desc:
The driver CAN throw an exception if the given querybuilder is not supported.
An example would be a SQL querybuilder and a Cassandra driver.

Plasma\\Schemas\\Transaction.name: Plasma\Schemas\Transaction
Plasma\\Schemas\\Transaction.short_desc: Represents a Transaction. This class wraps a Transaction.

commit.name: commit
exceptions: Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

createSavepoint.name: createSavepoint
createSavepoint.short_desc: Creates a savepoint with the given identifier.
exceptions: Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

execute.name: execute
execute.short_desc: Prepares and executes a query. Resolves with a `QueryResultInterface` instance.
execute.long_desc:
This is equivalent to prepare -> execute -> close.
If you need to execute a query multiple times, prepare the query manually for performance reasons.
exceptions: Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

getIsolationLevel.name: getIsolationLevel
getIsolationLevel.short_desc: Get the isolation level for this transaction.

isActive.name: isActive
isActive.short_desc: Whether the transaction is still active, or has been committed/rolled back.

prepare.name: prepare
prepare.short_desc: Prepares a query. Resolves with a `StatementInterface` instance.
exceptions: Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

query.name: query
query.short_desc: Executes a plain query. Resolves with a `QueryResult` instance.
exceptions: Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

quote.name: quote
quote.short_desc: Quotes the string for use in the query.
exceptions: Thrown if the driver does not support quoting.
Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

type.name: type
type.short_desc: For types, see the driver interface constants.

releaseSavepoint.name: releaseSavepoint
releaseSavepoint.short_desc: Releases the savepoint with the given identifier.
exceptions: Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

rollback.name: rollback
exceptions: Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

rollbackTo.name: rollbackTo
rollbackTo.short_desc: Rolls back to the savepoint with the given identifier.
exceptions: Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

runQuery.name: runQuery
runQuery.short_desc: Runs the given querybuilder on the underlying driver instance.
runQuery.long_desc:
The driver CAN throw an exception if the given querybuilder is not supported.
An example would be a SQL querybuilder and a Cassandra driver.
